This equation can be proved using combinatorial techniques.

The left-hand side of the equation can be interpreted as the number of ways to choose n elements from a set of 2n elements, and then choose 2 elements from those n elements. This can be expressed as:

(2n choose n) \* (n choose 2) = (2n!) / (n! (2n-n)!) \* (n!) / (2! (n-2)!) = (2n \* (2n - 1) \* n \* (n - 1)) / (2 \* 2!)

The right-hand side of the equation can be interpreted as the number of ways to choose 2 elements from a set of 2n elements, and then choose n - 2 elements from the remaining 2n - 2 elements. This can be expressed as:

(2n choose 2) \* (2n - 2 choose n - 2) = (2n!) / (2! (2n-2)!) \* (2n - 2)! / ( (n-2)! (2n - 2 - (n - 2))!) = (2n \* (2n - 1) \* (2n - 2) \* (2n - 3)) / (2 \* (n-2)!)

Since both sides of the equation result in the same expression, the equation is true, and this constitutes a combinatorial proof.
